perturbation.original_text: Contractor shall apply for and receive the ISO13488 standard for the production facility, by no later than . During the term of this Agreement, the manufacturing services provided by the Contractor hereto shall confirm in all material respects with the ISOl3488 standard.
perturbation.changed_text: Contractor shall endeavor to maintain reasonable quality standards for the production facility, with the goal of achieving something similar to the ISO13488 standard. During the term of this Agreement, the manufacturing services provided by the Contractor shall adhere to quality levels that are deemed commercially acceptable.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced a clear, defined quality standard (ISO13488) with vague language ('reasonable quality standards', 'commercially acceptable'). This makes enforcement uncertain because 'reasonable' and 'commercially acceptable' are subjective and open to interpretation, unlike the ISO standard which is objective and verifiable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law regarding enforceable standards; quality control regulations in manufacturing.

perturbation.original_text: For the purpose of this Agreement, “Warranty Period” shall mean twelve (12) months as of the date of delivery to Customer. Contractor represents and warrants that, for the Warranty Period, the Products (i) will be free from defects in workmanship, material (only to the same extent as the original manufacturer of the material warrants the Contractor), and manufacture; (ii) will comply the Specifications IPC610.B standard (in all material respects and unless otherwise was instructed by Customer). Contractor further represents and warrants that the Product will consist of new materials.
perturbation.changed_text: For the purpose of this Agreement, “Warranty Period” shall mean approximately twelve (12) months as of the date of delivery to Customer. Contractor represents and warrants that, for the Warranty Period, the Products (i) will be mostly free from defects in workmanship, material (only to the same extent as the original manufacturer of the material warrants the Contractor), and manufacture; (ii) will comply with general industry practice. Contractor further represents and warrants that the Product will consist of mostly new materials.
perturbation.explanation: The modification introduces ambiguity by using terms like 'approximately,' 'mostly,' and 'general industry practice,' instead of clear, definable terms like 'twelve (12) months,' 'free from defects,' and a specific industry standard (IPC610.B). This makes it harder to enforce the warranty because the exact terms of the warranty are no longer well-defined and deviates the intention of the parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law regarding express warranties; standards for product quality.

perturbation.original_text: Customer shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless Contractor from all claims, liabilities, costs, damages, judgments and attorney’s fees resulting from or arising out of any alleged and/or actual infringement or other violation of any patents, patent rights, trademarks, trademark rights, trade names, trade name rights, copyrights, trade secrets, proprietary rights and processes or other such rights elated to the Product or claims relating to Customer’s instructions, tooling, specifications and designs (“Claims”) provided that: (i) Contractor will provide the Customer with prompt written notice of any Claim no later than three (3) business days following receipt of notice by Contractor
perturbation.changed_text: Customer shall endeavor to defend, indemnify and hold harmless Contractor from possible claims, potential liabilities, expenses, harm, determinations and legal representation fees stemming from any possible violation of intellectual property in connection with the Product or Customer's directives and plans (“Possible Issues”) provided that: (i) Contractor will strive to furnish Customer with timely notification of any Possible Issues within a reasonable timeframe following awareness by Contractor
perturbation.explanation: Modified clear legal terms (e.g., 'claims, liabilities, costs, damages') with vague, subjective terms ('possible claims, potential liabilities, expenses, harm'). Changed concrete timeframes (three (3) business days) to subjective timeframe ('reasonable timeframe following awareness'). These changes introduce significant ambiguity, making it difficult to determine the scope of the indemnity and the timeliness of notification, undermining the enforceability of the indemnification clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law regarding indemnification clauses; requirements for clear and definite terms in contracts.
